docs.summary:
The wix-pricing-plans-backend module contains functionality for managing your
 site's pricing plans from backend code.
description: Use the Pricing Plans API to create and manage your pricing plans.
You can build a customized membership plan experience based
on the plans that you create and manage with the Pricing Plan APIs.
To use Pricing Plans APIs to manage your plans, first set up your site to:
+ Accept payments as described in [About Accepting Payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-accepting-payments).
+ Offer membership plans as described in [About Pricing Plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-pricing-plans). When setting up your site to accept pricing plans,
[define the plans you want to offer](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-a-plan-in-pricing-plans).
### Set Up and Manage Pricing Plans
You can use the Pricing Plans API to create and manage plans. You can:
+ Create and update pricing plans.
+ List and query pricing plans.
+ Set which plans are public and which plans are hidden.
+ Archive plans.
+ Set or clear the primary plan. This determines if a plan is highlighted
with a custom ribbon when viewing the plans on the site.
+ Get statistics about the plans.
+ Rearrange the order of how plans display.
### About Ordering Pricing Plans
Plans can be purchased, or ordered for later purchase (for a customizing the purchase flow).
+ A purchase created by the APIs is similar to purchasing a plan directly on a site.
+ Ordering a plan with APIs gives you the opportunity to customize the purchase process, such as by adding your own lightboxes and forms.
When creating or updating a plan, you can set if a plan can be ordered/purchased by a given site member only once or multiple times using the `maxPurchasesPerBuyer` property.
Updating the properties of a pricing plan does not affect any current purchases/orders of the plan by site members. The purchases/orders retain
their existing terms and pricing.
### Purchasing Pricing Plans
Members can purchase pricing plans in 2 ways:
+ **Online**. Members order and pay for their plans
on your site without manual intervention.
+ **Offline**. Members place their order by phone, text, or email. You
manually record each stage of the transaction.
You can use the Pricing Plans APIs to manage the purchase of both online and offline orders.
![orderflows](../assets/images/ordering.png)
#### A Typical Online Ordering Flow
1. Use the Pricing Plans [`createPlan()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/createPlan) API to create the plans you want to offer on your site.
1. A site visitor chooses a plan for purchase.

1. Use the Checkout [`previewPrice()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/previewPrice) function to show the site visitor a preview of how much the plan will cost, including or excluding taxes, as defined on your site.
1. If the site visitor confirms, ask the visitor to log in.
1. Use the Checkout [`previewOnlineOrder()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/previewOnlineOrder) function to get final confirmation.

1. After receiving confirmation, call the [`createOnlineOrder()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/createOnlineOrder) function to start a draft of the order. `createOnlineOrder()` returns a `wixPayOrderId`.
1. Direct the order to Wix Pay's [`startPayment()`](wix-pay/startPayment) function, sending the `wixPayOrderId` as an input parameter.
1. After payment is made, the functionality available with the Orders APIs is available for managing the orders.
#### A Typical Offline Ordering Flow
1. Use the Pricing Plans [`createPlan()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/createPlan) function to create the plans you want to offer on your site.
1. A site visitor contacts you offline to make a purchase.

1. Use the Checkout [`previewPrice()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/previewPrice) and the [`previewOnlineOrder()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/previewOnlineOrder) functions to send the buyer the order details for confirmation.
1. Call the [`createOfflineOrder()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/createOfflineOrder) function to start a draft of the order.
1. Receive payment.
1. After payment is made, call the Orders [`markAsPaid()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.checkout/markAsPaid) function.
1. The functionality available with the Orders APIs is available for managing the orders.
### Roles and Permissions
You need "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) to perform

management functions, such as [`createPlan()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/createPlan), [`updatePlan()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/updatePlan), [`archivePlan()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/archivePlan), and so on.
The following roles are predefined with "Manage Pricing Plans" permissions when the Pricing Plan app is added to the site:
+ [Owner](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#owner1072)
+ [Admin (Co-Owner)](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#admin-co-owner)
+ [Website Manager](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#website-manager)
+ [Website Designer](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#website-designer)
+ [Back Office Manager](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-overview#back-office-manager953)

You do not need "Manage Pricing Plans" permissions to use the [`listPublicPlans()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/listPublicPlans) and [`queryPublicPlans()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/queryPublicPlans) functions.
### About Pricing Models
Pricing models contain the [pricing and duration options](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-about-pricing-plans#pricing-duration-options) for a plan.
Plans are based on a pricing model, which is defined with the plan's `pricing` property.
A pricing model can be one of the following:
+ **A subscription**: A plan with recurring payment cycles. Subscription plans
can have free trial days.
*Example*: A subscription that lasts for a duration of 1 year (4 payment cycles)
with recurring payments. Each
payment is $25, so the total price for the plan is $100. The buyer can cancel
any time (because in this example `buyerCanCancel` is `true`).
The `cycleDuration` cycle is the payment cycle.
Multiply `cycleDuration`'s `count` by `cycleCount` to get the subscription duration.
Outside of the pricing model, set `buyerCanCancel` to `true` to allow the buyer to
cancel.
```javascript
"pricing": {
"subscription": {
"cycleDuration": {
"count": 1,       // payment recurs every
"unit": "MONTH"   // month
"cycleCount": 4     // for 4 times
"price": {
"currency": "USD"
"freeTrialDays": 7    // free for 7 days
"buyerCanCancel": true,
+ **A plan that does not renew**: A plan that is paid for with a
single payment. The plan does not renew after the duration.
*Example*: A plan with a single payment of $35. The plan lasts for a
duration of 1 month only and does not renew.
The duration (`count` and `unit`) is the plan duration (not a payment cycle
duration).
```javascript
"pricing": {
"singlePaymentForDuration": {
"count": 1,                  // Plan duration is 1 month
"unit": "MONTH"
"price": {
"currency": "USD"
*Example*: A plan that is paid for in advance with one single
payment of $50 and is valid for 6 months.
```javascript
"pricing": {
"singlePaymentForDuration": {
"count": 6,
"unit": "MONTH"
"price": {
"currency": "USD"
+ **An unlimited plan**: A plan paid for with a single payment. The plan does not
expire (until cancelled).
*Example*: An unlimited plan that is paid for in advance with one
payment of $200. As with any other type of pricing model, outside of the `pricing` pricing model,
you can set `buyerCanCancel` to `true` so the buyer can cancel the plan if desired.
```javascript
"pricing": {
"singlePaymentUnlimited": true,
"price": {
"currency": "USD"
"buyerCanCancel": true,
### Pricing Plan Types and Visibility
+ **Public pricing plans** are visible plans that site members and visitors can see on the site and purchase. By default, pricing plans are public when created.

+ **Hidden pricing plans** are plans whose `public` property has been set to `false`. These plans cannot be seen on the site by the site member or visitor. For example, consider hiding a plan if it has reached its maximum capacity and temporarily is not available for purchase.
Changing a plan’s visibility with the `public` property does not impact existing purchases. All purchases for hidden plans are still active and keep their terms and payment options.
+ **Active pricing plans** include all non-archived plans (such as public plans and hidden plans).
+ **Archived pricing plans** are plans that are no longer needed on the site, for example, discontinued plans.

When a plan is archived, it is no longer visible as a public plan that can be chosen by site visitors. The `public` property is automatically set to `false` when a plan is archived. Archived plans cannot be purchased.
Site owners can see archived plans in the Dashboard under **Pricing Plans -> Archived Plans**.
Archiving cannot be reversed (meaning, once archived, a plan cannot be set as active again for site members/visitors to purchase).
Archiving does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases are still active and keep their pricing and terms.
### Importing Pricing Plans
To use the Pricing Plans API, import `wixPricingPlansBackend` from the `wix-pricing-plans-backend` module.
> **Note**: The Pricing Plans API currently uses ordering and purchasing functionality provided by the [Paid Plans API](wix-paid-plans.html).
To use Velo for customized plan ordering and purchasing, import `wixPaidPlans` from the `wix-paid-plans` module also, until ordering
and purchasing is available from the Pricing Plans API.
```javascript
import wixPricingPlansBackend from 'wix-pricing-plans-backend'; // for managing plans in backend code
import wixPricingPlans from 'wix-pricing-plans';                // for customized, client-side plan ordering and purchasing
// in frontend code

docs.summary: The Pricing Plans Checkout API provides functionality for ordering and checking out pricing plan orders created in the Wix Pricing Plans app or using this Wix Pricing Plans API.
The Pricing Plan Orders API provides functionality for managing pricing plan orders created in the Wix Pricing Plans app or using this Wix Pricing Plans API.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the active plan to archive.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The archived plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Archives a single pricing plan.
description: The `archivePlan()` function returns a promise that resolves to the newly-archived plan.
When a plan is archived, the plan:
+ Is no longer available for display or selection by visitors. This is because
the plan's `visibility` property is automatically set to `false`.
+ Cannot be purchased.
+ Cannot be "un-archived" (meaning, the plan cannot be made active again).
Plan archiving does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases for the
plan are still active and keep their payment options and terms.
Site owners can see archived plans in the Dashboard under **Pricing Plans -> Archived Plans**.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can archive plans.
> **Note:** An attempt to archive an already-archived plan throws an error.

examples.title: Archive a plan
body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to a plan object for the archived plan:
*    "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

params.name: ids
params.doc: IDs of all non-archived plans in the order you want them arranged.

docs.summary: Changes the display order of the pricing plans on the site page and in the Dashboard.
description: The `arrangePlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the plans are rearranged
on the site page and in the Dashboard.
To rearrange the order of the plans, provide a list of IDs for all
non-archived plans in the desired order, including hidden plans.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can arrange plans.
> **Note:** Make sure to provide *all* non-archived plan IDs to avoid unpredictable results.

examples.title: Arrange plans
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void

docs.summary: Sets all pricing plans as not primary.
description: The `clearPrimary()` function returns a Promise that resolves when no pricing plan is
marked as a primary plan.
After clearing the primary plan, when viewing pricing plans on the site, no plan
is highlighted with a customizable ribbon.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can clear the primary plan.

examples.title: Make no plans primary, clearing the highlight and the ribbon on the site
body: // No pricing plans are set as primary. This means
// no plans are highlighted with a custom ribbon
console.log("No plans are highlighted on the site");
// Returns a promise that resolves to void

params.name: planInfo
params.doc: The information for the plan being created.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The created plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Creates a pricing plan.
description: The `createPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a newly-created pricing plan after it has successfully been created.
The passed `PlanInfo` object must contain a [pricing model](wix-pricing-plans-backend/introduction). A pricing model is one of the following:
+ **A subscription**: A subscription with recurring payments and how often the plan recurs. Subscriptions can have free trial days.
+ **A plan that does not renew**: A single payment for a specific duration that does not renew.
+ **An unlimited plan**: A single payment for an unlimited amount of time (until cancelled).
Pricing plans created by this function are available to the site owner in the Pricing Plans section in the Dashboard.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can create plans.

examples.title: Create a plan
body: "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",
*   "description": "Gold membership to the MyGame World of Online Gaming",

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the plan to get.

docs.summary: Gets an existing pricing plan by ID.
description: The `getPlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a plan whose ID
matches the given ID.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can get plans.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Overall statistics about the pricing plans.

docs.summary: Gets statistics about the pricing plans.
description: The `getPlanStats()` function returns a Promise that resolves to statistics about the plans
on the site.
Currently this function provides only the total number of pricing plans, including archived plans.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can get plan statistics.

examples.title: Get statistics for the pricing plans
body: /* Statistics object relevant to the site's pricing plans:
*   // Count of all plans (public, hidden and archived)

params.name: planIds
params.doc:
IDs of plans to list. You can pass a maximum of 50 IDs. 
 If not specified, all public and hidden plans (based on the `options`) are listed (up to 50), according to the [order](wix-pricing-plans-backend/arrangePlans) displayed 
 in the Dashboard. If non-existent IDs are specified, they are ignored and do not cause errors.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when getting the list of plans.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of plans that match the given criteria.

docs.summary: Lists pricing plans.
description: The `listPlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 pricing plans.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can use this function to list plans.

examples.title: List plans
body: // Array of all the specified pricing plan objects that match the criteria

examples.title: List archived plans
body: console.log("First plan is: " + firstPlanName + " and the rest are: ");
// Array of all the specified pricing plan objects that match the criteria

params.name: planIds
params.doc:
IDs of public plans to list. You can pass a maximum of 50 IDs.
 If not specified, all public plans are listed (up to 50), according to the [order](wix-pricing-plans-backend/arrangePlans) displayed 
 in the Dashboard. If non-existent IDs are specified, they are ignored and do not cause errors.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when getting the list of public plans.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of public pricing plans.

docs.summary: Lists public pricing plans.
description: The `listPublicPlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 100 public pricing plans.
Public plans are visible plans that site visitors can see on the site and purchase.
You do not need "Manage Pricing Plans" permissions to list public plans.

examples.title: List public plans
body: // Array of the specified public pricing plan objects

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the plan to be set as the primary plan.

docs.summary: Marks a pricing plan as the primary pricing plan.
description: The `makePlanPrimary()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
pricing plan that is now the primary one.
Only a single plan can be marked as a primary plan at any given time. If
there is an existing plan marked as primary, calling `makePlanPrimary()`
causes the existing primary plan to lose its status.
When viewing pricing plans on the site, the primary plan is highlighted
with a customizable ribbon.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can mark a plan as a primary plan.

examples.title: Make a plan a primary plan
body: /* Full plan object - primary is true:
*       "There are no words to describe this extreme game",

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The query definition used to run the query using the [`find()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/find) function.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of public pricing plans.
description: The `queryPublicPlans()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 1,000 public plans and returns a
[`PublicPlansQueryBuilder`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using
the [`find()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/find) function.
You can refine the query by chaining [`PublicPlansQueryBuilder`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder) functions onto the query. `PublicPlansQueryBuilder`
functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryPublicPlans()` returns.
`queryPublicPlans()` runs with the following [`PublicPlansQueryBuilder`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder) defaults that you can override:
+ [`skip`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.PublicPlansQueryBuilder#skip): `0`
+ [`limit`](wix-pricing-plans-backend.PublicPlansQueryBuilder#limit): `50`
The functions that are chained to `queryPublicPlans()` are applied in the order they are called. For example,
if you sort on the `_createdDate` property in ascending order and then on the `_id` property in ascending order,
the results are sorted first by the created date of the items and then, if there are multiple results with the
same date, the items are sorted by `_id` in ascending order, per created date value.
The following [`PublicPlansQueryBuilder`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder) functions are supported for `queryPublicPlans()`.
|Property|Filters|Examples|

|`_id`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`hasSome()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/hasSome)|`hasSome("_id", ["46ce4cd4-46ff-13a1-43ac-02fd4f0f3209", "94ce4cd4-46cc-20c3-4c7a-03fd4f0f3306"])`|

|`primary` |[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ascending), [`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/descending)|`eq("primary",true)`|

|`slug`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`startsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/startsWith), [`endsWith()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/endsWith), [`contains()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/contains), [`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ascending), [`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/descending)|`eq("gold")`|

|`_createdDate`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/gt), [`ge()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ge), [`lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/lt), [`le()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/le), [`between()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/between), [`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ascending), [`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/descending)|`lt("_createdDate", "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z")`|

|`_updatedDate`|[`eq()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/eq), [`ne()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ne), [`gt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/gt), [`ge()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ge), [`lt()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/lt), [`le()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/le), [`between()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/between), [`ascending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/ascending), [`descending()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryBuilder/descending)|`ge("_updatedDate", "2020-04-27T10:00:00.000Z")`|
>**Notes:**
> + When using the `queryPublicPlans()` function immediately following a change to your plans,
>   the data retrieved may not contain your most recent changes. See [Wix-data and Eventual Consistency](wix-data/introduction#wix-data-and-eventual-consistency)

>   for more information. To solve this problem, you can use the [`setTimeout()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/JavaScript/Asynchronous/Timeouts_and_intervals#setTimeout) function to delay
>   querying following any changes to your plan data.

>   The [`find()`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/find) function executes the query based on this query object, and returns the actual result, [`PublicPlansQueryResult`](wix-pricing-plans-backend/PublicPlansQueryResult).
> + You do not need "Manage Pricing Plans" permissions to query public plans.

examples.title: Build and execute a query to find all public plans
body: *     "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",

params.name: id
params.doc: The ID of the plan to either display or hide on the site page.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The plan's information.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Sets visibility for non-archived pricing plans. Public plans are plans that are set to visible.
description: The `setPlanVisibility()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a pricing plan when its
visibility has successfully been set.
By default, pricing plans are public, meaning they are visible. [Plans can be hidden](https://support.wix.com/en/article/pricing-plans-removing-a-plan-from-your-site#hiding-plans)
so that site members and visitors cannot see or choose them.
As opposed to archiving, setting visibility can be reversed. This means that a public plan
can be hidden, and a hidden plan can be made public (visible).
>**Note:** An archived plan always remains archived and cannot be made active again. When archiving
> a plan, its `visibility` property is automatically set to `false` so that it is hidden.
Changing a plan’s visibility does not impact existing orders for the plan. All orders for hidden plans are still active and keep their terms and payment options.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can change plan visibility.

examples.title: Hide a plan
body: console.log("Plan hidden");  // Plan is visible in the Dashboard

params.name: planInfo
params.doc: The information for the plan being updated.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The updated plan.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Updates a pricing plan.
description: The `updatePlan()` function returns a Promise that resolves to an updated plan.
Updating a plan does not impact existing purchases made for the plan. All purchases keep the details of the original plan
that was active at the time of purchase.
Only users with "Manage Pricing Plans" [permissions](https://support.wix.com/en/article/roles-permissions-accessing-roles-permissions) can update plans.

examples.title: Update a plan
body: "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",
*   "description": "Updated description for the original Gold plan",

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: List of text strings that promote the pricing plan (for example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday").

members.name: public
members.doc: Whether the plan is public (visible to site visitors). Defaults to `true`.

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Whether the same buyer can purchase the plan multiple times. `1` means the buyer can only purchase the plan once. An empty value or `0` means no limitation. Defaults to empty.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. Defaults to `true`.  If `true`, calling the [`cancelOrder()`](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information is displayed during checkout.

docs.summary: Length of one payment cycle, for example, 3 months to have quarterly payments.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of days, months, weeks, or years.

members.name: unit
members.doc:
Days, months, weeks, or years.
One of:
 + `"DAY"`
 + `"WEEK"`
 + `"MONTH"`
 + `"YEAR"`

docs.summary: Length of one payment cycle, for example, 3 months to have quarterly payments.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of days, months, weeks, or years.

members.name: unit
members.doc:
Days, months, weeks, or years.
One of:
 + `"DAY"`
 + `"WEEK"`
 + `"MONTH"`
 + `"YEAR"`

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of pricing plans to list. Defaults to 50.

members.name: skip
members.doc: Number of pricing plans to skip. Defaults to 0.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Archived filter. Defaults to ACTIVE (not archived) only.
One of:
 + `"ACTIVE"`
 + `"ARCHIVED"`
 + `"ARCHIVED_AND_ACTIVE"`

members.name: public
members.doc:
Visibility filter. Defaults to PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN (meaning, both are listed).
One of:
 + `"PUBLIC_AND_HIDDEN"`
 + `"PUBLIC"`
 + `"HIDDEN"`

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of public pricing plans to list. Defaults to 50.

members.name: skip
members.doc: Number of public pricing plans to skip. Defaults to 0.

docs.summary: Amount for a single payment. For subscriptions, this is the amount to pay for each single payment cycle and it is required. Otherwise, the single payment for the entire plan.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (for example, 3.99). Cannot be negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be a valid [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code (for example, USD).

docs.summary: Amount for a single payment. For subscriptions, this is the amount to pay for each single payment cycle and it is required. Otherwise, the single payment for the entire plan.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (for example, 3.99). Cannot be negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be a valid [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) currency code (for example, USD).

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc: When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation. Defaults to `false`.

docs.summary: A text string promoting the pricing plan (for example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday").

members.name: value
members.doc: Text listing one perk of this plan.

docs.summary: List of text strings that promote the pricing plan (for example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday").

members.name: value
members.doc: A list of strings promoting the pricing plan.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Plan ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: List of text strings that promote the pricing plan (for example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday").

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: public
members.doc: Whether the plan is public (visible to site visitors).

members.name: archived
members.doc: Whether the plan is archived. Archived plans are not visible and can't be purchased anymore, but existing purchases remain in effect.

members.name: primary
members.doc: Whether the plan is marked as primary. If `true`, the plan is highlighted on the site with a custom ribbon. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: hasOrders
members.doc: Whether the plan has any orders (including pending and unpaid orders).

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date plan was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date plan was last updated.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly version of the plan name. Unique across all plans in the same site.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. If `false`, calling the [`cancelOrder()`](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error.

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Whether the same buyer can purchase the plan multiple times. `1` means the buyer can only purchase the plan once. An empty value or `0` means no limitation.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information is displayed during checkout.

members.name: plans
members.doc: List of public and hidden pricing plans.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of plans created, including active plans (both public and hidden) and archived plans.

docs.summary: Pricing plan's pricing details, such as the plan price, payment schedule, and expiration. The payment schedule and expiration are based on one of three [pricing models](wix-pricing-plans-backend/introduction): `subscription`, `singlePaymentForDuration`, or `singlePaymentUnlimited`. Only one pricing model can be specified per plan.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan has recurring payments. This type of subscription is not a "Wix subscription," which encompasses various types of subscriptions, such as Wix Stores subscriptions, Wix invoice subscriptions, and *all* pricing plan models.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid with a single payment per cycle and what the length of the cycle is. The cycle is the duration of the plan, not a payment cycle.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid in one single payment and that the plan is valid until canceled.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment. For subscriptions, this is the amount to pay for each single payment cycle and it is required. Otherwise, the single payment for the entire plan.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the plan in days. Available only for recurring plans, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`.

docs.summary: Pricing plan's pricing details, such as the plan price, payment schedule, and expiration. The payment schedule and expiration are based on one of three [pricing models](wix-pricing-plans-backend/introduction): `subscription`, `singlePaymentForDuration`, or `singlePaymentUnlimited`.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan has recurring payments.

members.name: singlePaymentForDuration
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid with a single payment per cycle and what the Length of the cycle is. The cycle is the duration of the plan, not a payment cycle.

members.name: singlePaymentUnlimited
members.doc: Pricing model indicating that the plan is paid in one single payment and that the plan is valid until canceled.

members.name: price
members.doc: Amount for a single payment. For subscriptions, this is the amount to pay for each single payment cycle and it is required. Otherwise, the single payment for the entire plan.

members.name: freeTrialDays
members.doc: Free trial period for the plan in days. Available only for recurring plans, meaning plans whose pricing model is `subscription`.

docs.summary: Public pricing plan entity containing information about the pricing plan. Can be read by any site member or visitor.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Plan ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Plan description.

members.name: perks
members.doc: List of text strings that promote the pricing plan (for example, "Plenty of parking" or "Free gift on your birthday").

members.name: pricing
members.doc: Plan price, payment schedule, and expiration.

members.name: primary
members.doc: Whether the plan is marked as primary. If `true`, the plan is highlighted on the site with a custom ribbon. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date plan was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date plan was last updated.

members.name: slug
members.doc: URL-friendly version of the plan name. Unique across all plans in the same site.

members.name: allowFutureStartDate
members.doc: Whether the buyer can start the plan at a later date. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: buyerCanCancel
members.doc: Whether the buyer is allowed to cancel their plan. Defaults to `false`. If `false`, calling the [`cancelOrder()`](wix-paid-plans/cancelOrder) function returns an error.

members.name: maxPurchasesPerBuyer
members.doc: Whether the same buyer can purchase the plan multiple times. `1` means the buyer can only purchase the plan once. An empty value or `0` means no limitation. Defaults to empty.

members.name: termsAndConditions
members.doc: Any terms and conditions that apply to the plan. This information is displayed during checkout.

members.name: publicPlans
members.doc: List of public pricing plans.

docs.summary: The pricing plan has recurring payments.

members.name: cycleDuration
members.doc: Length of one payment cycle, for example, 1 month to have monthly payments. Multiply `cycleDuration`'s `count` by `cycleCount` to get the subscription duration. *Currently, only a value of `1` is supported.*

members.name: cycleCount
members.doc: Number of cycles. Zero for unlimited plans and plans that are valid until canceled.

docs.summary: The pricing plan has recurring payments.

members.name: cycleCount
members.doc: Number of cycles. Zero for unlimited plans and plans that are valid until canceled.
